questions.question_body: Mercury married this mute nymph, who was a sister of Juturna.
Although his mother's name is disputed, what was the name of Jason's father?
Which was not a Roman name for Hades?
What couple was responsible for repopulating the earth with stones?
Athena's mother was the Titaness named _________?
Which deity was the father of the ram with the golden fleece?
The dead who were deemed neither good nor bad were sent to ____________ in the underworld.
Zeus unfettered this island, to allow the mother of Artemis and Apollo to escape Hera's wrath.
This child of Tantalus, bewitched by Artemis, threw himself/herself into flames.
In what form did Zeus visit Danae?
Who taught Heracles to wrestle?
Whom did Aphrodite cause to perpetually be in love because of the affair she had had with Ares?
Which deity had the epithets Dithyrambos, Eleutherios, and Enorches?
What beautiful woman is known to have the face that launched a thousand ships?
Which of these is most associated with Melampus?

question_options.A: his severe punishment in the underworld
question_options.B: his ability to speak to animals

questions.question_body: Which of these mythological islands was home to the Sirens?
Who trained the hero Achilles after Cherion?
Which individual was NOT transformed into a flower?
Inachus, a minor river god, was the father of which unfortunate maiden?
What caused Semele's death?

question_options.C: being gored by a wild boar

questions.question_body: Which minor god of wealth was the child of Iasion and Demeter?
What son of Oeneus, Meleager's half-brother, was sent with the Argonauts to look after Meleager? He shares his name with a more well-known, ill-fated man.
At what body of water did the fleeing Syrinx beg the local nymphs to transform her, as she was unable to cross it in her flight from Pan?
Which of these is one of the names for the evil brigand, defeated by Theseus, who ripped individuals apart with pine trees?
What group of people mounted an attack on Hercules and Geryon's cattle? Hercules used all his arrows defending himself against them.
Carna, a nymph, who later became goddess of the hinge, was wooed by what Roman god?
What disturbing thing did Demeter inadvertently eat?
Which king of Sicily hosted Aeneas and his men during Anchises' funeral games?
Which two individuals recognized Odysseus on his return to Ithaca?
Which son of Zeus and early king of Troy was welcomed to the area by Teucer and given the hand of his daughter Bateia?
The Graeae, the Gorgons, Echidna, and Ladon are all the children of whom?
Which of the following was not one of the Erinyes?
What queen of Libya bore Zeus's children only to have them stolen away by a jealous Hera?
Which of the Giants was killed by Heracles' arrows as he attempted to rape Hera?
What prize did the Sirens give to the Muses after being defeated in a musical contest?
What names were given to the three Hesperides?
Which individual did not tend for Zeus as an infant?
What is the general name for the giant sons of Iphimedia and Poseidon, Otus and Ephialtes?
Which Greek god carried a bident?
Dictys succeeded Polydectes as king of which kingdom?
Which of the following were not sons of Apollo?
Mars asked which woodland goddess for help in his wooing of Minerva?
What uncatchable beast was turned to stone along with Laelaps, the inescapable hound?
What is the name of the magical flower used by Odysseus to ward off Circe's magic?
What Cretan stole the golden mastiff that guarded the infant Zeus?
After Icarius was murdered by Athenian farmers unused to strong drink, how did his daughter Erigone find the body of her murdered father?

question_options.A: being led to the spot by Dionysus
question_options.B: the wine missing from his farm
question_options.C: the howling of his dog Maera
question_options.D: the reports of the Attic farmers

questions.question_body: Which daughter of Anius could turn anything she touched into wine?
Selene and Eos were the daughters of the Titans named?
Of what island was Odysseus king?
Which miracle did not happen while Dionysus was captured by Tyrrhenian pirates?

question_options.A: the ship halted in frozen water
question_options.D: wreaths crowned the thole pins of the ship

questions.question_body: What hero captained the Argo on the quest for the Golden Fleece?
What goddess, born parthogenically from Zeus' head, was the goddess of wisdom, strategic warfare, and domestic crafts, and was depicted with a spear, the aegis, olives, and an owl?
What kind of animal was Pegasus?
What god of warfare was represented by dogs and woodpeckers, was the son of Hera and Zeus, and had an affair with Aphrodite?
What was the Roman name for the Greek god Thanatos?
Which of the following was NOT a river in the Underworld?

What woman had to perform impossible tasks for Venus, such as separating thousands of grains, gathering golden fleece from fierce rams, collecting the water of the river Styx, and entering the Underworld to obtain a box of beauty from Proserpina ?
Which Titan accepted a gift from the gods, Pandora, who had been created by Hephaestus and given many enticing attributes by the other gods?
What Roman woodland god presided over plowmen and woodcutters?
Which one of these groups helped Zeus defeat the Titans?
What story did Hermes tell Argus to make the guardian fall asleep?

question_options.B: The creation of man from stone (Deucalion)
question_options.D: The invention of the Syrinx pipes

questions.question_body: According to Ovid, which of the following did NOT occur when Orpheus sang to Pluto and Proserpina in the Underworld?

question_options.A: Sisyphus sat still on his rock

questions.question_body: On what island, sacred to Aphrodite, did Pygmalion and Galatea live?
What man did the Argonauts defend against the Harpies?
Who was told by the seer Polyidus to sleep in Athena's temple to learn how to capture a fabulous animal?
What son of Minos' death began the Athenian tribute to Crete that Theseus ended?
Which monster did Heracles defeat, but NOT as one of his 12 labors demanded by Eurystheus?
Who bribed Myrtilus to sabotage the chariot race for Hippodameia's hand?
What ability did Poseidon grant Mestra so that she could help her father Erysichthon feed his insatiable hunger?

question_options.B: Seeing into the earth for treasure
question_options.D: Instantly growing wine, olives, and grain

questions.question_body: What Trojan prince was the lover of Aurora, father of Memnon, and changed into a grasshopper?
What priestess of Hera was the mother of Biton and Cleobis?
Who were the parents of Orestes, Iphigenia, and Electra ?
What son of Zeus and Aegina prayed to have his island repopulated by men created from ants after Hera devastated his land with a plague?
What god's other names or epithets were Aidoneus, Eubouleus, and Zeus Katachthonios?
What group, said to be the daughters of either Nyx or of Zeus and Themis, were also called Moirai?
What two children escaped from certain death by flying on the back of a golden ram?
What three sisters resisted the worship of Dionysus, were driven mad, tore apart one sister's son, Hippasus, and were eventually turned into bats?

According to Euripides' Orestes, what woman arrived in Argos on the day of Orestes' trial, only to be taken hostage by Orestes and Pylades when her husband refused to defend his own nephew against the charge of matricide?
What ability as a priestess of Hecate did Medea claim to have to the daughters of Pelias?

question_options.A: She could make inanimate things move
question_options.B: She could turn anything she touched to gold
question_options.C: She could make old people young again
question_options.D: She could change men into women

questions.question_body: What king of Troy refused to pay Apollo and Poseidon for building the walls of the city, which resulted in Troy being attacked by a sea monster and a plague?
What baby with injured feet was exposed on Mt. Cithaeron, found by shepherds, and raised by King Polybus and Queen Merope as their own son?
Who avenged his son Palamedes' murder at Troy by causing many wives of Greek heroes to be unfaithful, and by destroying many of the returning ships with a false beacon-fire off cape Caphareus?
Which of the following men was NOT a teacher of Heracles?

What daughter of Phorcys and Ceto was the so-called 'Mother of Monsters,' because she bore the Chimaera, the Hydra, the Sphinx, the Nemean Lion, the Crommyonian Sow, and the eagle that tortured Prometheus?
Which of the following abstract deities was NOT born from Chaos?
What god convinced Hephaestus to release Hera from the trap of the golden throne?
What king in Italy was the grandson of Picus and Circe, and abdicated his throne to Aeneas?
What two men were sent as emissaries to Priam to demand Helen's return?
After the Epigoni marched on and conquered Thebes, to whom did the Argive army turn over the rule of Thebes when they left?
What aggressive, meddlesome member of Odysseus' crew escaped Circe's pig-spell and caused Odysseus to land on Thrinacia to kill Helius' cattle?
What Thessalian Greek, upon leaving Troy found a chest containing an image of Dionysus, which had been cursed by Cassandra, and which drove him mad?
Which of the brigands conquered by Theseus had a daughter named Perigune?
What nymph, a companion of Artemis, did Minos pursue for nine months, until, in order to avoid his advances, she jumped off a cliff into the sea, but was saved by being caught in fishermen's nets?
What Roman god was a deity of fertility and agriculture and was thought to protect crops against diseases? Sacrifices to him would be red in color as that was the color of wheat rust.
What Greek warrior took Helenus, one of Troy's prophets, as a slave after the Trojan War, and was advised by this seer not to travel home by sea, but to return by land instead?
For what event did Penelope weave the shroud with which she delayed the suitors?
What brother of Deianeira gave Heracles permission to marry his sister from the Underworld?
Salmacis was one of what kind of atypical naiads who lived in particularly dangerous rivers?
According to Ovid, what mortal playmate of the child Zeus was turned into magnetic stone for saying that Zeus was mortal?

When he created mankind, Prometheus created a series of clay human prototypes for Zeus' inspection, but because of the beauty of one of the models, Prometheus failed to present him. What was the name of this clay proto-human, whom Zeus kidnapped and turned into the planet Jupiter?
This god was the husband of Amphitrite, the creator of horses, and the deity of earthquakes.
What king of Arcadia was turned into a wolf?
What goddess changed one of her followers into a bear after the girl was seduced by Zeus?
Which of the following heroes did Cheiron NOT rear or educate?
Which of the following was a constellation of 7 stars formed from 7 sisters who are perpetually chased by the constellation Orion?
Where did Apollo have his most famous shrine and priestess, the Pythia?
What daughter of Hyperion and Theia drove a silver chariot drawn by 2 horses across the sky and was the mother of 50 daughters by Endymion?
What man, the fiancé of Andromeda, did Perseus change to stone using Medusa's head?
According to the Aeneid, what goddess feared and hated all Trojans, but especially Aeneas because he was destined to found Rome?
What many-­‐eyed watchman guarded Io for Hera?
Who was the son of Procne and Tereus, who was killed by his mother in revenge for Tereus' treatment of Philomela?
What companion of Achilles stole his armor and wore it into battle in order to rally the Greeks when Achilles would not fight?
What woman, a princess from Crete, married an Athenian king, fell in love with her stepson, and committed suicide in order to turn the boy's father against him?
What instrument of Orpheus continued playing itself as it floated down the Hebrus river after the musician's death?
What son of Tantalus was fed to the gods and, after being restored to life, needed his shoulder replaced with a piece of ivory?
What goddesses were renamed the Eumenides, or Kindly Ones, after Athena acquitted Orestes of the murder of his mother?
What did Erysichthon do to earn his punishment of being eternally hungry?

question_options.A: He sold his daughter into slavery
question_options.C: He stole ambrosia from the gods
question_options.D: He cut down a sacred tree

questions.question_body: To what island did Daedalus escape on his invented wings?
What monsters plagued the prophet Phineus until the Argonauts, Zetes and Calaias, chased them away?
What hero was originally born as Alcides, but was given a new name by the Pythia when he tried to atone for the murder of his wife and children?
According to Hesiod's Theogony, what daughter of Chaos was the mother of Aether (Upper Air), Hemera (Day), Morus (Destiny), Hypnus (Sleep), Momus (Sarcasm), Nemesis, and the Hesperides?
Which deity has the epithets Ktesios, Hupsibremetes, Nephelgerete, and Asteropetes?
Which goddess, the eldest child of Cronus and Rhea, refused to marry either Poseidon or Apollo, vowing to remain a virgin?

What man, described by Homer as bowlegged, lame in one foot, and stooped with a misshapen head, was killed by Achilles when he ridiculed the hero for falling in love with Penthesileia after she was killed?
From whom did Odysseus acquire his great bow, which once originally belonged to Eurytus, the famous archer?
What god did Cadmus have to serve for a 'great year' or a period of 8 years to atone for killing a dragon?
Who sent Bellerophon to his father-­‐in-­‐law Iobates with a letter ordering the king to kill the bearer of the letter?

What king of Argos led 7 chiefs from the whole of the Peloponnese with the exception of the Maeceneans, Agamemnon and Menelaus, who foresaw the expedition would fail, in order to help Polyneices and Tydeus reclaim their thrones?

Although the more common story is that Medea killed her two sons, there is another myth that claims the two boys were stoned to death by enraged Corinthians while they took refuge at Hera's altar. Both versions agree that their names were
During the Gigantomachy, the gods learned that they would never defeat the giants with out the aid of a mortal. Whom did Athena recruit?

When Leto was searching for a place to bear Apollo and Artemis, Zeus put the goddess into the care of Poseidon, who circumvented Hera's ban that no land under the sun shall receive her, by covering what island with waves?
Who was born because Heracles prayed to Zeus that his friend Telamon be given a brave son? Zeus sent his assent in the form of an eagle.
What two boys were sons of Tyro by Poseidon, reared by horse-­‐herders, and became kings of Pylus and Iolcus?
What obscure Roman god's altar was discovered underground by Romulus? This god had a connection with horses and was often worshiped together with Ops.
What daughter of Schoeneus was exposed at birth, suckled by a bear, and raised by huntsmen?
What river of the underworld, whose water was collected by Iris for sacred oaths, was the eldest daughter of Oceanus and Tethys and the mother of Zelus, Nike, Cratus, and Bia?

What King of the Edonians drove away Dionysis with an ox-­‐goad, was struck with madness in retaliation so that he hacked away his own feet believing them to be grape vines, and was bound by his own people to Mt. Pangaeus and trampled by horses in order to relieve the land's barrenness?
What mystical animal which could fly and speak did Poseidon father on Theophane?
What god assisted Paris when he shot Achilles?
What son of Poseidon was killed by Theseus at Cenchreae either by being torn apart when the hero tied him to two pine trees or when he was catapulted by a bent-­‐pine tree?
Who is the Roman equivalent of the minor goddess, Hebe?
During hunting trip at what man's home in Parnassus—the same man who named Odysseus at birth—did the king of Ithaca receive the wound on his thigh which later served to identify him?
Although Ceres was the Roman goddess of the grain, which god presided over the act of sowing grain because it represented the beginning of the crop?
What Titan ruled during a golden age in which men lived like gods and death was no more than a sleep, then later became king of the Islands of the Blessed?
Against what invaders from Crete, followers of Dionysus called the 'Women of the Sea' did Perseus fight and with whom he eventually reached a truce that allowed Dionysus to bury Ariadne in Argos?
What Lesbian girl, daughter of Epopeus, after being raped by her father and hiding in the woods because of her shame, did Athena pity and change into an owl?
According to Vergil's Aeneid, which of the following was NOT one of the heroes hidden in the Trojan horse?

What woman, born because Aphrodite caused a goddess, Derceto, with a woman's face and the body of a fish to fall in love with a mortal, was rescued by doves, raised by shepherds, married the king's advisor Onnes, then married King Ninus after Onnes killed himself, and became queen in her own right after Ninus died?

What mortal was taught the lyre by Linus, supposedly taught Homer to sing, and foolishly challenged the Muses to a musical contest which he lost, and as a result, was struck blind and stripped of his musical talent?

What nobleman exacted revenge on king Demiphon for the unjust death of his own daughters by mixing the king's daughters' blood in a bowl with wine and serving it to the king, who when he realized what he had drunk, flung the bowl and the nobleman into the sea?
She was Apollo's first love but, wishing to remain a virgin forever, she pleaded to her father and was transformed into a laurel tree.
What sorceress so enchanted Odysseus that he remained on her island of Aeaea for a full year?
Which of the centaurs, the only immortal one, was the wisest of them all?
What young man was the leader of the Quest for the Golden Fleece?
What woman boasted that she was more worthy of praise than Latona because her fourteen children outnumbered the goddess' two? She was eventually turned into a weeping rock.
Whose stables at Elis did Heracles have to clean in one day for one of his famous twelve labors?
When Deucalion and Pyrrha asked the oracle of Themis for advice following the great deluge, they were given which of the following orders:

question_options.A: Loosen the foot of their wineskin only after you reach the top of the mountain
question_options.B: Build an arc and take with you a pair of every animal you can find
question_options.C: Plant the seeds from the nearest tree at the foot of the mountain
question_options.D: Cast over your shoulders the bones of your mother

questions.question_body: What river-­‐god did not recognize his daughter, recently transformed into a heifer, until she spelled out her name on the ground with her hoof?
Who, the eldest of the Pleiades, bore the god Hermes to Zeus?
Which of the following was not one of the Fates?
According to Olen, what goddess of childbirth was the mother of Eros?
During his second labor, Heracles elicited the help of his nephew Iolaus to kill the monstrous Hydra. How did Heracles, together with his wife Hebe, later repay him?
Who, after being transformed into the constellation Ursa Major, was not allowed to settle below the horizon by a jealous Juno?
Who was the god of healing and the son of Apollo and Coronis?
Her name is a feminine form of Zeus and, according to Homer, she was the mother of Aphrodite.
She was the muse of epic poetry and the mother of Orpheus.
Together, this couple of deities reared Hera after she was born.
What woman unwittingly sent her husband Alcmaeon to his death when she asked for the infamous necklace and robe of Harmonia as bridal gifts?
Her father made all her suitors beat him in a chariot race before they could win her hand in marriage. Pelops eventually did.
To which island did Dictys take the chest containing Danae and Perseus? His brother Polydectes was king here.
What Athenian king was born from the earth and had a man's body ending in a snake's tail? He was the arbiter between Athena and Poseidon for the patronage of Athens.
Which of the following was not one of the Hechatonchires?
He was an offspring of Poseidon and Medusa and the father of Geryon. His name means "Golden Sword."
She was the goddess of victory, daughter of Pallas and Styx, and was a constant companion of Zeus.
Who saw right through Odysseus' feigned insanity and was able to successfully enlist the Ithacan king to the Trojan War? Odysseus eventually got his revenge.
What infant child was foolishly left on a bed of parsley by his nurse Hypsipyle while she was showing the Seven Against Thebes to way to a spring?
What Cretan spirits were entrusted with the care of the infant Zeus? To drown out his cries, they danced around and clashed their spears and shields.
Which of the Argonauts was so skilled at boxing that he killed the Bebrycian King Amycus with one blow to the ear?
They were warned by their mother not to fall into the hands of Blackbottom. Eventually, their thievery was stopped when Zeus transformed them into monkeys.
According to some accounts, to what mortal woman did Zeus give the hound Laelaps as a watchdog in Crete?
Into what kind of bird was Tereus transformed?
What name is common to a daughter of Deucalion who gave birth to Delphus, eponym of Delphi, and an unfaithful serving maid of Odysseus and daughter of Dolius?
What woman was kidnapped by Theseus and Pirithous when they determined that they would marry daughters of Zeus? She was later rescued by her brothers Castor and Pollux.
Which of the following is not associated with the god Hermes?
Before Priam was married to Hecuba, he was married to this woman who bore a son, Aesacus. Who was this lesser known wife of Priam?

She was first carried off by Achilles after her husband, parents, and brothers were killed during a Greek invasion. Later, she was taken by Agamemnon and became his concubine for some time. Give the more common name for this unfortunate girl from Lyrnessus, whose real name was Hippodamia.
His only claim to fame is that he reared the Chimaera, the fire-­‐breathing monster that ravaged Lycia and was eventually killed by Bellerophon.
Who are the parents of Eumelus, the husband of Penelope's sister Iphthime?
What epithet of Dionysus means "Thunderer"?
During the Gigantomachy, which of the giants was killed after Apollo shot an arrow into his left eye and Heracles shot one into his right?
Under what name did Demeter wander into the palace of Celeus at Eleusis?
What mountain supposedly contained a cave which was the haven of the infant Zeus? This mountain was also said to be the home of the Harpies.
Where was Nestor when all of his siblings and his father Neleus were killed by Heracles? Some say he was raised and educated here.
What king became the first man to murder a family member when he killed his father-­‐in-­‐law Eioneus?
To what mythological group do the following belong: Erytheia, Hestia, Aegle, and Arethusa? This group showed the Argonauts a spring that Heracles had once created.

When Poseidon lost to Hera in the competition for the patronage of Argos, he left the land destitute of water. When Danaus arrived with his fifty daughters, he sent some of them to find water. Which of this group of sisters, tired by the search, fell asleep by the wayside and woke up, terrified, to the sight of a satyr trying to ravish her?
When Dionysus intended to retrieve his mother from the Underworld, what native guide agreed to show the god the route only if he would lie with him?
She was a daughter of Oceanus and, together with the Telchines, she brought up the infant Poseidon on the island of Rhodes.

According to Book II of Ovid's Metamorphoses, this old man observed Hermes stealing cattle from Apollo. Hermes ordered him to not tell anyone what he had seen but, not trusting him, the god returned in disguise and asked the old man where the cattle went, promising a reward in return. When this old man told him what he saw, Hermes revealed himself and punished this man by turning him to stone.
According to legend, what Titan saved his mother Ge from the wrath of Zeus by producing a fig tree under which she could take shelter from the Zeus' thunderbolts?
Mercury killed the monster Argus while he was guarding the princess
Deucalion and Pyrrha were the only ones left alive after

question_options.A: the great flood sent by Jupiter killed all the people on earth.
question_options.B: Jupiter and Mercury destroyed their neighbors for lack of hospitality.
question_options.C: Hercules sacked Troy because Laomedon refused to pay him.
question_options.D: The plague on Aegina destroyed the population.

questions.question_body: The nine goddesses who inspired poets and musicians were the
The winged horse Pegasus was ridden by the hero
The King of the Winds who gave Odysseus a sack containing all the winds save one was
Helen's seduction by _____________ began the Trojan War.
The Cyclops Polyphemus ate

question_options.C: his rival for the love of Galatea.

questions.question_body: Hercules did the twelve labors to atone for killing
Although Daedalus escaped from Crete, his son, _______, drowned.
Medea killed her brother to ensure the escape of
The symbol of Pan is the
Theseus loved the princess _____________, but was forced to leave her behind on Naxos.
Phaethon was killed by _________________ to prevent the destruction of the earth.
The criminal in the Underworld who was punished with perpetual hunger and thirst was
What son of Oenomaeus dressed as a girl to win the friendship of Daphne, but was killed after the girls stripped him to swim and discovered his ruse?
The only one of the Lemnian women to spare a man was the queen, _________.
At the end of the Trojan War, Andromache became the concubine of
When Hector attacked the Greek ships after the withdrawal of Achilles, they were saved primarily by the efforts of
When the spy, Dolon, was captured, he gave the Greeks important information about
Which of the following wives was NOT induced to cuckold their husband by Nauplius?
Zeus rained tears of blood on the Plain of Troy because he could not save
Odysseus was twice saved from
The list of people visited by Odysseus which is in the correct order is

question_options.A: Laestrygonians, Lotus Eaters, Polyphemus, Calypso, Circe.
question_options.B: Lotus Eaters, Laestrygonians, Polyphemus, Circe, Calypso.
question_options.C: Lotus Eaters, Polyphemus, Laestrygonians, Circe, Calypso
question_options.D: Laestrygoinans, Polyphemus, Lotus Eaters, Circe, Calypso.

questions.question_body: Phoenix was Achilles'
The nymph who was changed into a stream because she tried to stop the abduction of Persephone was
In Egypt, Hercules defeated _______________, who killed all strangers to his land because of an oracle which said that this was the only way to keep the land free from famine.
Hercules was sold to _________, Queen of Lydia, for a period of a year.
Hercules saved the Trojan princess ___________ from a sea monster.

What king, a son of the river god Strymon and one of the muses, after being thrown into the river by his mother, was raised by water nymphs, fought in the Trojan War, and became an ocular spirit after his death?
Hercules killed Ladon to get access to the
A man-eating turtle was a favorite pet of
Theseus had to make his way from Troezen to Athens to prove himself worthy of the throne of his father
What king of Epeirus became proverbial for his cruelty for blinding his own daughter, locking her in a dungeon, and forcing her to grind grains of bronze?
To marry his bride, Perseus first had to kill her fiancé __________and his supporters.
The hero Bellerophon was sent away by King Iobates because Iobates' wife, ___________, had accused him of attacking her.
Acamas and Demophon rescued their grandmother, ________,who had been carried off to Troy to serve Helen.
Aeneas' ships were changed into nereids by the goddess____________ when Turnus tried to burn them.
Aeneas finally learned from _________ that the land he sought was in Italy
Oedipus wandered for many years, but finally died at Colonus in peace, protected by
The Argo was able to avoid the hazards posed by the Planctae with the help of
When Dionysus was kidnapped by pirates, the only member of the crew to oppose the idea of selling him as a slave was
After the death of Dido, Anna eventually came to Italy because she was fleeing

What man, the first demagogue, stirred up the people of Athens against Theseus while he was detained in Hades, induced Castor and Polydeuces to invade to recover their sister, and expelled Theseus upon his return?

What youth loved the sea nymph Argyra, died of heartbreak after she tired of him, and was turned into a river by Aphrodite, only to continue to pine for Argyra, so that the goddess gave him the second gift of forgetfulness?
Vertumnus, the god of vegetable gardens, fell in love with the orchard goddess __________.
The consort of Astraeus who gave birth to Zephyrus, Boreas, and Notus was the goddess
The Greek king who lived for three generations by the gift of Apollo because Apollo gave him the years that he had stolen from the sons of Niobe, his grandmother, was
Daedalus came to Crete

question_options.A: because he had been hired to build the labyrinth.
question_options.B: because he had been exiled from Athens for murder.
question_options.C: because he wanted to marry Minos' daughter, Acalle.
question_options.D: because he was a relative of the queen, Pasiphae.

questions.question_body: While she was helping Aeneas in battle, Aphrodite was wounded by
At the beginning of the Trojan War, the Greeks sent _______ and ________ to demand that the Trojans return Helen.
Terpsichore was the Muse of:
The names of the Three Fates were:
He was married to Pandora.
Daphne was changed into a _______.
The North Wind was ____.
Peleus and Thetis were the parents of:
The parents of Heracles (Hercules) were:
He served his son in a stew to the Gods and was eternally punished.
Hypnos was the twin of:
Which god loved and lost both Hyacinth and Cyparissus?
Which sister of Turnus tried in vain to keep him from challenging Aeneas to battle?
Hypermnestra was the only Danaid who spared the life of her husband, whose name was:
Who warned the Trojans to "beware of Greeks bearing gifts"?
Who fed Diomedes to his own man-eating mares?
Iphigenia came to Aulis expecting to marry:
The Propoetides, who offended Aphrodite and later disgusted the sculptor Pygmalion, were reportedly the first prostitutes. They lived on which island?
Which of these was Aeneas' ally in the Italian war?
Besides Pegasus, who also sprang from Medusa when she was beheaded?
Who was the only one of the original seven to survive the attack on Thebes?
The fisherman who was turned into a merman and fell in love with Scylla was:
The Big Dipper is the constellation associated with the story of:
Who was told by an oracle that he would be killed by his grandson?
How was Perithous punished for trying to abduct Persephone? He was:

question_options.B: placed in a chair of forgetfulness
question_options.C: enslaved for the rest of his life

questions.question_body: What mythological name was shared by the father of Hypsipyle and and a king of the Taurians?
Which Titan stole fire from the gods and gave it to men?
Which Argonaut was so swift that he could run across waves without getting his feet wet?
Hera was said to have been reared by the Seasons or the daughters of what Argive river god?
Which of the following was NOT a judge in Hades?
Which deity was known as "Twice-born"?
Briareus, Cottus and Gyges were all:
Who was forced to become a Vestal Virgin?
Which is the correct order of those whom Odysseus visits?

question_options.A: Laestrygonians, Lotus Eaters, Polyphemus, Calypso, Circe
question_options.B: Lotus Eaters, Laestrygonians, Polyphemus, Circe, Calypso
question_options.C: Lotus Eaters, Polyphemus, Laestrygonians, Circe, Calypso
question_options.D: Laestrygoinans, Polyphemus, Lotus Eaters, Circe, Calypso

questions.question_body: Memnon of Ethiopia, who died fighting for Troy, was the son of:
What river became known as the Evenus after the father of Marpessa drowned himself in it?
To which group did the river Styx belong?
Who was the guard of the heifer-maiden Io?
Why was the outlaw Periphetes called Corynetes?

question_options.A: Because of the club he carried.

questions.question_body: What two men, the brothers of Briseïs, did Achilles kill when he sacked Lyrnessus?
In Latin they were individually called Nona, Decuma and Morta. However, they are usually referred to by their Greek names, or by their group name, the:
Diomedes carried away from Troy the Palladium, a statue of:
What squire of Idomenus was second-in-command of the Cretans at Troy?
Into which river did Phaethon fall after Zeus struck him from the sun-chariot?
Who won the archery contest at the funeral games of Anchises when his arrow burst into flame?
What was the Minotaur's name, the same name as his step-grandfather?
What Thespian youth offered to sacrifice himself to a dragon in order to save his lover?
To what god of the Getae did the Thracians sacrifice a man every year by flinging him onto three spears?
Which two men were sent as emissaries to Priam to demand Helen's return?
She was a daughter of Oceanus and, together with the Telchines, she brought up the infant Poseidon on the island of Rhodes.
During a dangerous night expedition in the Iliad, two Greek soldiers captured and killed which Trojan spy?
What was the name of the first Pythia?
The Muses are said to reside on what sacred mountain?
Which sorcery goddess was, according to Hesiod, Zeus' bringer-of-victory?
Upon being gored by a wild boar, into what kind of flower did Adonis turn?
After Jupiter flooded humanity, what early goddess of prophecy told Deucalion & Pyrrha to "throw the bones" of their mother?
Which Titanic couple are the parents of three of the four winds?
Who was tricked by Mercury into tattling about Apollo's stolen cattle?
Speaking of tattling, who tattled to Pluto about Persephone eating the pomegranate seeds and was turned into an owl as punishment?
Who was the step-mother of Theseus, who tried to kill him in favor of her own son?
For Achilles having murded Diomedes' cousin, Thersites, Diomedes dragged which beautiful Amazonian queen behind his chariot?
Life After The Iliad, Part One: Diomedes was exiled from Argos. He eventually ends up in Italy, marries a princess, and is deified after his death. What place was that?
What mythological creature was decapitated by Perseus?
Against whom did Odysseus hold a grudge for endangering baby Telemachus and causing Odysseus to reveal he was, in fact, sane—dragging him into the Trojan War?
Which son of Oedipus was supposed to share the throne of Thebes, but instead forced his brother, Polynices, into exile?
Who travelled to the underworld to retrieve this bride Eurydice?
C.S.I.: Aegina—Peleus and his brother, Telemon, were forced to flee Aegina for murdering their brother. Who was that unfortunate sibling?
What wife of Oceanus is also considered the mother of rivers?
Poseidon's curse caused this wife of Minos to lust for a bull?
Which of the bandits faced by Theseus is known for pushing passers-by off a cliff?
This vain musician dared the Muses to a contest (hoping to seduce one of them); he was defeated, blinded, made unable to play lyre, and later tortured in the Underworld?
What river god—and former enemy of Hercules—did Theseus meet up with on his return from the Calydonian Boar Hunt?
Which Titan is the father of Atlas, Epimetheus, Prometheus, and Menoetius?
Pan pursued what nymph until she turned into the reeds Pan would use for his flute?
Perseus rescued and married Andromeda, the princess of Aethiopia. Who was her father who betrothed Andromeda to her rescuer?
The son of Heracles' twin brother, who helped Heracles defeat the Lernean Hydra?
It was at a wedding feast for Theseus' friend that a fight between centaurs and Lapiths became the Centauromachy. Who was that bridegroom-friend of Theseus?
Life After The Iliad, Pt. Two: Teucer became a servant of which Phoenician king—father of The Aeneid's Dido—from whom he received dominion over the island of Cyprus?
Which goddess is credited with turning a hunter into a stag, killing Niobe's children, unleashing the Calydonian Boar, and helping her mother give birth to her brother?
Who was the father of the hero, Jason, and the rightful king of Iolcus?
C.S.I.: Thebes—Driven mad by Hera, which of his wives did Heracles murder?
Ignoring the natural order, who fell in love with her own brother, Caunus, forcing him into self-exile when her handmaiden delivered a love note to him?
For having chopped down a tree sacred to Ceres, Famine caused whom to eventually consume nearly everything in his kingdom—even himself?
On what island was Hephaestus reared by Thetis?
Known for being a master thief, what son of Mercury is also the one credited with teaching a young Hercules how to wrestle?
Which god(dess) spread salve and made other efforts to preserve Hector's body every day that Achilles abused it?
Who was the princess of Megara who betrayed her father, Nisus, by cutting of his purple lock of hair (that granted him invincibility) and presenting it to Minos?
Life After The Iliad, Pt. Three: Clytemnestra, along with her lover, murdered Agamemnon soon after his return to Mycenae. Who was her lover and accomplice?

C.S.I: Iolcus—At it again, Peleus is drawn into a love triangle between Iolcus' king, Acastus, and his queen. After Acastus tries to have him killed by centaurs, Peleus sacks Iolcus and dismembers the queen. Who was this woman murdered by the vengeful Peleus?
3,200-YEAR-OLD SPOILER! At the close of The Iliad, Priam finally convinced Achilles to hand over Hector's body. How does the book end?

question_options.C: Achilles gets shot in the heal

questions.question_body: When Io wandered into Egypt, she returned to human form and gave birth to what progenitor of Egyptian royalty?
What woman was spirited away by Jupiter in the form of a bull and lends her name to a continent?
Life After The Iliad, Pt. Four: receiving her comeuppance when Troy fell, which daughter of Priam tricked Achilles into revealing his weakness to her?
What son of Callisto was turned into a bear before he could kill his now-bear mother?
Who was the Libyan giant whom Hercules defeated by lifting him off the earth (from whom he received his strength)?
C.S.I.: Corinth—What hero and future rider of Pegasus murdered a kinsman and therefore set out to atone for his crime?
In the Gigantomachy, who was the only giant to survive…because Gaia turned him into a dung beetle?
Who was the male cupbearer to the gods?
Atreus murdered his brother's sons and fed them to him. Who was this uncle of the Atreidai who sired a son by his own daughter to get his revenge upon his brother?
Which Greek goddess is known for presiding over strategic warfare, handicrafts, and wisdom?
Life After The Iliad, Part Five: This aged king of Pylos shows up (even more aged) in Homer's Odyssey instructing Odysseus' son, Telemachus?
Which of the Argonauts was so swift that he could run over water?
"Delian," "Lycian," "Sminthian," and "Phoebus" are all names or epithets of
The god of riches buried in the earth was
The god who persuaded Hephaestus to return to Olympus and release Hera from the golden chair he'd made for her was
Poseidon vied with ________for recognition as patron divinity of Argos but lost.
The Greek name for the god of love was
Terminus was a Roman god of ________________.
During the Golden Age, Italy was ruled by _____________.
The two-faced god of beginnings was ____________.
Sailors were lured to their death by the beautiful voices of the ______.
In the Underworld, souls about to be reborn drink from the _______.
According to Ovid, the Fourth Age of Man was the Age of ______.
In the war between Zeus and the Titans, the Olympians fought from Mt. Olympus and the Titans fought from Mt. ________.
Because Lycaon had served Zeus the flesh of the Molossian hostages, Zeus turned him into a _____________.
In the war with the giants, the giant Ephialtes was killed by ______ with the help of Heracles.
The horse Arion was the divine offspring of
Periclymenus the Argonaut was killed by ______.
Pyrrha, the wife of Deucalion, was the daughter of ______.
Bellerophon was sent to King Iobates with letters that accused him of
Perseus turned all of the following into stone EXCEPT ______.
The mother of the Cercopes had warned her sons about him by telling them to "beware the _______________."
The centaur _____ tried to carry off Heracles' wife, Deianira.
Theseus was eventually killed by _______.
Aegeus tried to get rid of Theseus by sending him to kill _______.
Meleager was killed because

question_options.A: he gave Atalanta the boar's hide.
question_options.B: he tried to protect Atalanta from the boar.
question_options.C: he did not sacrifice the boar to Artemis.
question_options.D: he killed his uncles when they attacked him.

questions.question_body: Castor the brother of Polydeuces was killed by ______.
Adonis was born from a myrrh tree into which his mother _____ had been changed when fleeing from her father.
After avenging the murder of her son Polydorus, Hecuba was changed into a ____.
The constellation Ursa Major was originally ______.
After finding the body of her husband Ceyx, Alcyone was changed into ______.
Dido's sister Anna drowned while fleeing the jealous anger of ______.
The Greek who led the defense of the Greek ships against Hector's onslaught after Achilles withdrew from the Trojan War was ______.
Achilles withdrew from the flighting at Troy after his concubine, _____, was taken from him.
Achilles was saved by the god _______ when he was attacked by the Scamander River which favored the Trojans.
Aeneas was told to "seek your ancient mother" by ________.

question_options.A: the oracle of Apollo on Delos.
question_options.C: the oracle of Apollo on Claros

questions.question_body: Aeneas rescued _________ from the Cyclops.
The lying Greek who persuaded the Trojans to take the horse into the city was
The wandering islands which crushed unwary sailors and which the Argo escaped with the help of the nereids were the _______.
The queen of the Lemnian women with whom Jason stayed for a year was ___.
Hylas was lost by the Argonauts on the island of _____.
The member of Odysseus' crew who died when he accidentally fell from Circe's roof was ____________.
The number of men lost by Odysseus in the cave of the Cyclops was ___.
The companion of Odysseus who urged his men to slaughter the cattle of Helios was ______.
The king of the Laestrygonians who attacked Odysseus was _____.
In his quest to marry Hippodamia, Pelops was aided by _____, who gave him a golden chariot with winged horses.
The wife of Atreus who stole a golden ram from him and gave it to his brother Thyestes was ______.
The famous walls of Thebes with their seven gates were built by _____.
The Theban queen who was dragged to death by a bull for her mistreatment of Antiope was _____.
The Athenian king who was part serpent was _________________.
Orestes was aided in his theft of the statue of Artemis from the Taurians by _____.
Oedipus was eventually buried at ______________.
Zagreus
questions.question_instruction: Match the mythological entities with their other name:

questions.question_body: Alcides

questions.question_body: Indiges

questions.question_body: Achilles

questions.question_body: Priam

questions.question_body: What daughter of Agenor was kidnapped by Zeus in the form of a bull?
The prow of the Argo was made from a sacred oak from what oracle of Zeus?
What brigand was known for feeding people to a man-eating turtle while he had them wash his feet?
Eurydice died when she stepped on a snake while fleeing what son of Apollo?
Andromeda was engaged to her uncle when she married Perseus. What was her uncle's name?
Who was the first of the Greeks to leap ashore at Troy and thus the first to die?
Which of the following was NOT the child of a Titan?
Who won the throne of Mycenae by causing the sun to reverse its path in the sky?
Who purified Medea and Jason of the murder of Apsyrtus?
According to Ovid, into what were the daughters of Oeneus changed after the death of Meleager?
What son of Poseidon and Thoosa loved the nymph Galatea?
Thebes was named after the wife of which of its kings?
Where was the first place Aeneas and his men sailed after leaving Troy?
Which of the following was not a child of Typhaon and Echidna?
When the gods fled to Egypt to escape Typhon, which was not an animal one of them transformed into?
According to Hesiod, who was married to the Grace Aglaea?
Who fought both as one of the Epigoni and at Troy, and wounded both Ares and Aphrodite in the Trojan War?
Who was the only one of the Seven Against Thebes to survive, thanks in part to his magic horse, Arion?

What name was shared by the following characters from mythology: a son of Antenor who fought in the Trojan War, Andromeda's fiancée according to some sources, the father of Argus Panoptes, and the father of Cadmus.
What drunken companion of Dionysus did Midas protect and entertain when he was separated from the god?
What wife of Neleus was the only daughter of Niobe to survive Apollo and Artemis' slaughter?
What muse was the mother of Orpheus?
Who was Paris' first wife, who refused to heal him after he was wounded in the Trojan War?
Into what did Latona change the Lycian peasants who refused to let her drink water when she was being pursued by Python?
Who was the Phaeacian princess who rescued the shipwrecked Odysseus?
The Areopagus was named because Ares was prosecuted there for the murder of what son of Poseidon?
Which of the following did NOT win a prize at an event at Anchises' funeral games in book V of the Aeneid?
Which of the following did NOT win an event at Patroclus' funeral games in book XXIII of the Iliad?
What pair of brothers either died of exhaustion while chasing the harpies away from King Phineus or were killed by Heracles after he found out they convinced the Argonauts to leave him?
Who accidentally killed his wife, Procris, with an infallible spear because he mistakenly thought she was a wild animal?
What member of Odysseus' crew did Aeneas save from the island of the Cyclopes in the Aeneid?
During the sack of Troy, who angered Athena by defiling Cassandra in the goddess's temple?
Which of the Argonauts ran so fast he could run across water?
Who was NOT one of Turnus' allies in his war against Aeneas?
Who was turned into the sea goddess Leucothea after she jumped into the sea with her son, Melicertes?
Who was the father of Callisto who was changed into a wolf because he fed Zeus human flesh?
What Greek hero carried off Helen to be his bride because he wanted to marry a daughter of Zeus?
Who tricked Odysseus into proving his sanity, thus making the Ithacan fit for service in the Trojan War?
Who was the mother of the god Pan?
According to Homer, who is the mother of Aphrodite?
Medusa

questions.question_body: Otus

questions.question_body: Neleus

questions.question_body: The goddess whose symbols are the owl, olive, and helmet is ______.
Venus is the Roman name for ______.
Hermes is the god of everything listed below EXCEPT ______.
______ was turned into a spider by Athena.
Demeter's daughter, ______, was married to Hades.
Shakespeare's play Romeo and Juliet is based upon ______.
Heracles goes to the oracle at ______ after he kills his wife and children.
______ held the yarn for Theseus so he could find his way out of the Labyrinth.
Queen Cassiopeia got into trouble with Thetis because she ______

question_options.C: boasted that her daughter was more beautiful.

questions.question_body: Odysseus was from the island of ______.
Which symbol is NOT associated with Mars?
Aeneas's parents were ______.
The gods who visited Baucis and Philemon disguised as beggars were ______.
Pluto and Dis are other names for ______.
The symbols of the peacock and cow are associated with ______.
______ was originally named Podarces, and his name meant "ransomed one."
The monster Echidna was a combination of a ______.
The Aegean Sea derives its name as a result of which event?

question_options.B: Theseus forgets to take down the black sails of his ship.
question_options.C: Jason obtains a crew for the Argo and sails to find the Golden Fleece.
question_options.D: Perseus goes on his quest to kill Medusa.

questions.question_body: The Cocytus is the river of ______.
Parcae is another word for the ______.
After Apollo gives Midas donkey's ears, his secret is eventually revealed by ______

question_options.A: reeds whispering what happened into the wind.
question_options.C: the gods gossiping about Midas' foolishness.
question_options.D: Apollo bragging about how he punished Midas.

questions.question_body: In the Underworld Ixion is punished by ______

question_options.B: being bound to a wheel of fire.
question_options.D: rolling a boulder up a hill.

questions.question_body: What pair repopulated the earth by throwing stones over their shoulders?
Jason and the Argonauts had to sail through ______ to get to the land of Colchis.
What daughter of Priam was sacrificed on the tomb of Achilles?
Odysseus lived with ______ for seven years before she helped him build a raft to leave her island.
How does Jason lose one of his shoes?

question_options.A: Helping an old lady (Hera in disguise) cross a river.
question_options.B: During his marriage to Glauce, the princess of Corinth.
question_options.C: Sailing to Corinth after he gets the Golden Fleece.
question_options.D: Fighting men who grew from dragon teeth.

questions.question_body: The Age of ______ is NOT part of Ovid's Ages of Man.
Aegina and Zeus are the parents of ______.
When old age completely overtook Tithonus he turned into a ______.
Which hero killed the Chimaera and also fought the Solymi and the Amazons?
Pegasus and ______ sprung from Medusa's neck after Perseus cut off her head.
Hebe and Ganymede were both ______
Which Fate measured out the thread of life?
To which city did Acrisius travel for the athletic event that resulted in his death?
Jupiter is the father of all of the following EXCEPT ______.
Melpomene is the muse of ______.
Deianira gave Heracles a robe dipped in blood because he had fallen in love with ______.
Neptune, with his helpers Triton and ______, saved the Trojan ships from being completely destroyed in Book 1 of the Aeneid.
In the Iliad, which two soldiers traded armor instead of fighting?
According to Ovid, who desired an ivory maiden for his wife?
To what king of Argos did Polynices come to seek advice on how to convince Amphiaraus to join the Seven Against Thebes?
All of the following apply to the Graiae EXCEPT ______

question_options.A: They were sisters of the Gorgons.
question_options.B: They were the daughters of Phorcys.
question_options.C: They shared one eye and one tooth.
question_options.D: They gave Perseus a helmet of invisibility.

questions.question_body: ______, son of Crius and Eurybia, was the father of the Anemoi.
What mythological crime was engraved on the swordbelt of Pallas?

question_options.D: Ajax slaughtering a flock of sheep

questions.question_body: ______ and his brother Ialmenus were both suitors of Helen, Argonauts, and leaders of the forces of Orchomenus in the Trojan War.
The doctor who tried to heal Aeneas' wound in Book 12 of the Aeneid was named ______.
Anchises, Aeneas's father, died in which Sicilian city?
Which youth, beloved of Apollo, became unconsolably sad when he accidentally killed his own pet stag?
______ grew jealous of Triptolemus and killed one of the snakes that pulled his winged chariot. Never fear! Demeter gave Triptolemus a spare snake.
What did Hermes use as the soundbox for the first lyre?
Which divinity is INCORRECTLY paired with its Homeric epithet?
Who killed his father and married his mother?
By the waters of which river would a deity swear their oaths?
According to Homer, which of the following was hated by his parents?
Who was the first-born child of Cronus and Rhea?
Which of the murderers encountered by Theseus was given the nickname "Procrustes"?
Agamemnon sent Odysseus, Phoenix, and _____ to convince Achilles to return to the battlefield.
Which of these was the Fate responsible for measuring the thread of life?
Who was the mother of Achilles?
Aphrodite's name means "Born of the ____."
After being put to sea in a chest, where did Perseus arrive safely?
Who plotted the demise of the children of Athamas and Nephele?
Which Harpy was the mother of Achilles' horses?
What youngest son of Priam was killed by Polymestor, King of the Bistones?
What poison did Aegeus nearly use to kill Theseus before recognizing who he was?
He was the Greek who convinced the Trojans to take the Trojan Horse into the city.
Where did Theseus die?
Who killed Paris?
What happened after Irus the beggar challenged Odysseus to fight?

question_options.A: Odysseus beat Irus with one soft but winning blow.
question_options.B: Irus backed down because he saw how strong Odysseus looked.
question_options.C: Odysseus let Irus win because he wanted to maintain his disguise.
question_options.D: Odysseus refused to fight because it would delight the suitors.

questions.question_body: Who tricked Eileithyia into "allowing" Alcmene to give birth?
Which Argonaut had the gift of extraordinary sight?
What poet sings in the court of Alcinous?
Which of the following were born at the same time as the Giants?
What water nymphs did the Romans later identify with the Greek Muses?
Which of Artemis's epithets deals with her birthplace?
By whom was Odysseus killed?
Which piece of Achilles' weapons/armor did Patroclus NOT take before entering battle?
According to Vergil's Aeneid, Minos was the judge of souls who _____.

question_options.B: had committed crimes against the gods

questions.question_body: In Vergil's Aeneid, to whom does Iarbus compare Aeneas?
Which of these was NOT a child of Hephaestus?
Which deity cut off a lock of Dido's hair, allowing her die?
Alectryon was turned into what kind type of bird?
Which of the following was a monster that ate children?
What was the name of the boy whom Demeter turned into a lizard?
Where did Psyche enter the underworld when she went to bring some of Proserpina's beauty to Venus?
Who killed Aegialeus, son of Adrastus?
On his way to retrieve Hippolyta's belt, Heracles killed the brother of which king?
Perseus accidentally killed Acrisius while participated in funeral games hosted by whom?
What king once convinced Hera that Zeus was about to take a new bride?
Rhadamanthys
